definition: to cower/to flinch/to quail/to recoil
to fear
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
cowering/cringing
to shrink back in fear (idiom); too cowardly to advance

sentences.english: The big boys jumped into the river but little Ned hung back.
sentences.chinese: 大些的男孩子都跳進河裏了，但小內德畏縮不前。

sentences.english: Tony be backward in propose to her .
sentences.chinese: 湯尼在向她求婚時畏縮了。

sentences.english: German banks are balking at writing off Greek debt.
sentences.chinese: 德國各家銀行在勾銷希臘債務方面畏縮不前。

sentences.english: He held out his hand unflinchingly for the cane.
sentences.chinese: 他毫不畏縮地伸出手去挨藤條打。

sentences.english: Varipowerful's voice echoed, as well as Anduin flinched slightly.
sentences.chinese: 瓦里安的聲響迴響着，讓安度因些微畏縮了點。

sentences.english: Greetings involving kissing caused me to wince, and hugging generally just made me feel awkward.
sentences.chinese: 寒暄時的親吻讓我畏縮，而擁抱則會使我陷入尷尬。

sentences.english: Jane didn't flinch once when the doctor cleaned the cut in her arm.
sentences.chinese: 醫生爲瓊清洗手臂上的傷口時，她毫不畏縮。

sentences.english: Worry, fear, self-distrust bows the heart and turns the spirit back to dust.
sentences.chinese: 煩惱，恐慌，畏縮，都會使你我身心超負，意氣如灰。

sentences.english: I flinched back from the venom in her voice.
sentences.chinese: 我因爲她話語裏的怨恨而畏縮了一下。

sentences.english: The enemy weakened in face of our attacks.
sentences.chinese: 面對我們的進攻，敵人畏縮了。

sentences.english: Tony is backward in propose to her.
sentences.chinese: 湯尼在向她求婚時畏縮了。

sentences.english: He was held back a year and still winces if anyone mentions it.
sentences.chinese: 他留級一年，如果有人提到這事他仍然畏畏縮縮。

sentences.english: The cost of this unflinching reappraisal will be large.
sentences.chinese: 毫不畏縮地進行重新評估成本會很高。

sentences.english: Fache never flinched, his eyes riveted on the second agent.
sentences.chinese: 法希毫不畏縮，他的眼睛一動不動地注視着那名特工。

sentences.english: The dog cringed at the sight of the whip.
He winces at the memory of that experience.
sentences.chinese: 他一回想起那番經歷就畏縮起來。

definition: to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
nowhere to go/at the end of one's tether
decline in fortunes
to have a sense of shame
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
to advance prematurely
to curry favor (idiom); playing up to those in power/social climbing
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
idle gossip
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
(literary) hypocrite/two-faced person
(Buddhism) retribution/karma
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
feudalism
hoodlum/bad guy
